question: Recently, scientists have discovered the first live specimen of a giant worm-like animal that plants itself into mud like carrots and feeds on noxious fumes of sulphur. It has been discovered in which country?
explanation: Recently, scientists have discovered the first live specimen of a bizarre, giant worm-like animal in the Philippines that plants itself into mud like carrots and feeds on noxious fumes of sulphur. Its tusk like shells, measuring three to five feet long, were first documented in the 18th century.
